title: articles & papers
text:
what I’ve (co-)written


0.1 Benchmarking Human Capital Spending Efficiency Using Bootstrapped Data Envelopment Analysis

I demonstrate how to conduct Bootstrapped Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) and generate distributions of efficiency scores. I examine expenditures in health and education and cross-country variation in human capital and find large potential efficiency gains for developing countries.



0.2 Back-of-Envelope Series: Estimating spending needs to meet SDG 2

I started a new series called the “Back-of-Envelope” Policy Series, where I calculate (very) rough estimates of a policy issue that interests me. For the inaugural “Back-of-Envelope” note, I estimated costs to meet “minimum hunger and nutrition needs” under specific scenarios.


This rough estimate is intended to contribute to efforts within the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) framework to end hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition, and promote sustainable agriculture by 2030 (SDG 2) from a social protection perspective.



0.3 (IMF Working Paper) Guaranteed Minimum Income Schemes in Europe: Landscape and Design

This paper provides an overview of the design of means-tested Guaranteed Minimum Income schemes, which constitute an important component of social protection systems in European countries. It discusses how key design features differ across countries, including how countries balance the primary objective of poverty alleviation against the desire to both manage the work disincentives inherent in such programs and contain fiscal cost.



0.4 (IMF Working Paper) Challenges Facing SSNs in Emerging and Developing Economies

We show how the standard social welfare framework can be used to assess the performance of social safety nets (SSNs) in terms of targeting efficiency and budget effort. We apply this framework to the World Bank’s ASPIRE database and find that the variation in poverty alleviation achieved by SSNs in emerging markets and developing economies (EMDEs) is driven mainly by variation in budget effort. Increasing transfer spending is therefore key to strengthening SSNs in EMDEs.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text: What’s new (overnight): The Ukraine reported that the Russian Armed Forces launched dozens of missiles and hundreds of drones overnight, damaging major energy‑infrastructure in Kyiv, Poltava and Kharkiv regions, killing at least three civilians. Meanwhile, the Philippines issued life‑threatening storm surge warnings as Typhoon Fung‑wong (local name Uwan) expanded toward the east coast with super‑typhoon potential. In the U.S., Congress remains gridlocked in the longest government shutdown in history, with fiscal‑hawk Republicans proposing flat‑spending continuing resolutions. Assessment: The combination of high‑intensity infrastructure targeting in Ukraine, severe weather risk in the Philippines, and U.S. fiscal uncertainty significantly raises business and financial systemic risk in three distinct zones. The Ukraine strikes suggest Russia will continue winter‑era escalation to degrade Ukrainian resilience; we assess this as likely. Confidence: moderate‑high. The Philippine typhoon poses imminent operational and supply‑chain risk in the Indo‑Pacific. Confidence: high. The U.S. shutdown remains ongoing and may materially affect global markets and federal services. Confidence: moderate.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Levant / Israel–Lebanon

Hostage diplomacy & cease‑fire signals. Palestinian Islamic Jihad handed over the body of a hostage in Gaza, reinforcing the current cease‑fire regime and delaying further escalation.
Proxy frontier hovering. Though no major new strikes reported overnight in southern Lebanon, the border remains volatile. The absence of visible escalation may reflect calculated latency by Hezbollah and the Israel Defense Forces.

Implications for business/finance: Shipping and insurance risk in the Eastern Mediterranean remains elevated, though the risk of full open war remains remote but non‑negligible in the near term. Confidence: moderate.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Black Sea / Ukraine

Infrastructure under fire. Russia launched “high‑precision” missiles and a drone barrage, including attacks on an apartment near Dnipro (2 killed) and one killed in Kharkiv region.
Retaliation or two‑way escalation. Kyiv reported drone strikes in Russia’s Vologda region (northern Russia) hitting an electricity sub‑station.
Implications: Winter energy‑security risk in Ukraine/Europe remains high, and the escalation could spur insurance/commodity‑price impacts. We assess that further attacks on critical infrastructure are probable in coming days. Confidence: moderate‑high.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
South China Sea / Philippines

Typhoon risk gateway. Typhoon Fung‑wong is forecast to intensify into a super typhoon as it approaches the Philippines’ eastern coast. Authorities warn of up to 5 m storm surges and widespread rainfall.
Strategic nexus. While the event is weather‑driven, its timing complicates regional security logistics and may distract from maritime security focus amid Indo‑Pacific tensions.

Implications: Regional supply chains (electronics, semiconductors, shipping) that transit the Philippines may face disruption. Firms should treat this as an immediate operational hazard. Confidence: high.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Latin America / Venezuela

Trans‑national gang takedown. Spanish authorities arrested 13 suspected members of the Venezuelan prison‑gang Tren de Aragua, in a first‑time cell disruption in Spain tied to Venezuelan‑origin organised crime.

Broader context: A recent U.S. Senate vote blocked a resolution aimed at restricting U.S. strikes on Venezuela, keeping military pressure vectors open.

Implications: Companies with Latin America exposure should monitor expanding law‑enforcement and potential adverse regime responses. Operational risk for regional logistics and commodities exists. Confidence: moderate.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Africa / Sahel–Horn–Sudan

Sudan war remains severe. The International Committee of the Red Cross warned that mass‑killings in Darfur are “history repeating” following the fall of El Fasher to the Rapid Support Forces (RSF).

Outlook: While no fresh overnight event, the lack of progress toward a peace settlement means the risk of further fragmentation and spill‑over into the Sahel remains significant.

Implications: Mining, agriculture and infrastructure firms operating near Sudan’s borders or in refugee‑hosting countries should assess escalating risk of supply‑chain disruption and insurance cost hikes. Confidence: moderate.

text:

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Near‑Term Business Actions

Freight & insurance review: Test war‑risk and weather‑risk coverage for East Med and West Philippine Sea routes; consider +20‑30 % spot‑rate shock for Philippine entering landfall period.

Energy supply chain buffer: For companies with exposure to Ukrainian/European winter‑heating markets, model +10‑15 % margin impact from infrastructure disruption and price spikes.

Counter‑party & region risk screening: For Latin America/logistics exposure, flag crime‑gang/regime linkage events as operational constraint points; reassess drilling/investment plans in the Caribbean/Caribbean basin accordingly.

Alternative routing & buffer stocks: Consider bypassing affected nodes—e.g., increase inventory or re‑route shipments around the Philippines; for Eastern Mediterranean, consider increased monitoring and alternative sea‑routes if escalation persists.

Governance and regulatory spotlight: For African‑region investment, companies should intensify monitoring of displacement flows and arms‑flow alerts in Sudan as early‑warning for logistic disruptions and insurance cost escalation.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
What’s new (last 48–72h): Israeli leaders reiterated that Lebanon must enforce ceasefire terms requiring Hezbollah’s disarmament and pullback; reporting also highlights ongoing precision strikes and UN/European statements about incidents affecting UNIFIL.
Assessment: Israel is likely to sustain calibrated, high‑precision strikes and cross‑border actions to compel state enforcement while avoiding a wider war. Escalation risk elevated but contained. (Confidence: moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Levant / Israel–Lebanon

Signals & kinetics. Public demands that Lebanon “fulfil commitments” on Hezbollah disarmament coincided with continued Israeli targeted strikes against Radwan‑linked elements near the Blue Line. UN and EU statements noted recent incidents endangering UN peacekeepers. (Confidence: moderate.)
Sources: Reuters (Nov 2, 2025); UNIFIL statements (Oct 26 & Oct 30, 2025); EU EEAS (Oct 28, 2025).
Political optics. The disarmament drive faces domestic constraints in Lebanon; LAF operations and cache seizures continue but broader moves risk confrontation absent political consensus. (Confidence: moderate.)
Source: Reuters (Oct 28, 2025).
Shift indicators. A large‑casualty strike north of the Litani would sharply raise escalation odds; conversely, visible LAF/UNIFIL seizures of major caches and reduced cross‑border incidents would lower near‑term risk. (Confidence: moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Black Sea / Ukraine

Pokrovsk fight. Russia and Ukraine report fierce urban combat in Pokrovsk, with Ukraine rotating SOF and emphasizing drone use while warning drones alone cannot hold the city. High‑tempo deep‑strike exchanges continue. (Confidence: moderate.)
Sources: Reuters (Nov 4–5, 2025); The Guardian (Nov 5, 2025); ABC AU (Nov 5, 2025).
Air defense & supply. Reporting points to continued air‑defense reinforcement and domestic ammo production partnerships. (Confidence: moderate.)
Sources: Defense News (Nov 3, 2025); The Guardian (Nov 5, 2025).

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
South China Sea / Philippines

Coalition‑building. The Philippines–Canada SOVFA (Nov 2) broadens Manila’s defense network after recent multinational patrols; Beijing counters with presence operations and sharper messaging. (Confidence: high.)
Sources: Reuters (Nov 2, 2025); AP (Nov 2, 2025); Government of Canada (Nov 2, 2025); SCMP (Nov 4, 2025).

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Latin America / Venezuela

Maritime & sanctions risk. Naval posturing and legal wrangling around oil cargoes and maritime seizures continue in the Caribbean approaches; Washington and Caracas maintain back‑channel engagement to avert incidents while sanctions calibration remains on the table. (Confidence: low–moderate, due to opaque channels.)
Sources: Reuters Americas (Nov 4–5, 2025); Bloomberg LatAm (Nov 5, 2025); The Cipher Brief overnight roundups (Nov 5, 2025).
Macro angle. Oil output guidance and debt litigation timelines interact with political calendar risk; insurers reassessing war‑risk and maritime liability bands for select lanes. (Confidence: moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Africa / Sahel–Horn–Sudan

Sudan (El Fasher corridor). SAF–RSF clashes and drone use persist around humanitarian chokepoints; aid deconfliction fragile. (Confidence: moderate.)
Sources: UN OCHA updates (Nov 4–5, 2025); AllAfrica/AFP (Nov 5, 2025); The Cipher Brief Africa notes (Nov 5, 2025).
Sahel security compacts. Junta coordination meetings signal deeper cooperation with Russia‑linked security providers; spillovers to Niger/Burkina gold routes likely. (Confidence: low–moderate.)
Sources: Africa‑Intelligence (Nov 5, 2025); Reuters (Nov 5, 2025).
Horn of Africa maritime. Piracy‑adjacent activity and detentions near key sea lanes remain episodic; insurance pricing sensitive to any spike in attempted boardings. (Confidence: low–moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Near‑Term Business Actions (72h)

Hedge & liquidity: Re‑check fuel and freight hedges; scenario‑test +20–30% spot freight on SCS lanes, +10–15% EU gas on grid headlines, and Caribbean tanker day‑rate spikes.

Coverage & clauses: Validate war‑risk riders for East‑Med, Red Sea, and Caribbean lanes; confirm force‑majeure and sanctions‑compliance clauses in supplier contracts.

Counterparty risk: Review exposures to Donetsk rail/energy nodes, Lebanese banking/FX, Venezuelan counterparties, and Sahel gold logistics.

Ops continuity: Identify alternate routings (e.g., via Indonesia/Australia for SCS; via Atlantic lanes for Red Sea risk) and buffer inventory at vulnerable nodes.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
What’s new (past 24–48h): Israel maintained calibrated airstrikes against Hezbollah-linked infrastructure in southern Lebanon following civilian evacuation alerts. UNIFIL confirmed cross-border air activity near Tayr Dibbah and Ayta al Jabal. Simultaneously, the U.S. Treasury announced new sanctions targeting Hezbollah’s Iran-linked financial network. (Confidence: moderate.)
Assessment: Israel likely aims to degrade Hezbollah’s logistical depth without triggering an all-out war. Diplomatic condemnation will not deter Israel’s precision-strike posture in the near term. Persistent East-Med war-risk premiums are expected through midweek. (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: Reuters, UNIFIL, AP (Nov 8–10, 2025).

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
What’s new (overnight): Following evacuation alerts in several south Lebanon towns, Israeli jets conducted heavy, targeted strikes against Hezbollah-linked infrastructure. In New York, Washington is moving to start Security Council negotiations on a resolution backing a two‑year international stabilization force for Gaza.
Assessment: Expect calibrated Israeli precision strikes aimed at constraining Hezbollah reconstitution while avoiding a broader war; ceasefire frictions will persist along the Blue Line. UNSC dynamics: procedural progress likely, but mandate scope (ROE, contributors, police integration) will be contested. Escalation risk elevated but contained. (Confidence: moderate.)
Key sources: Reuters (Nov 6–7, 2025); AP (Nov 6–7, 2025); UNIFIL statement (Oct 30, 2025).

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
What’s new (last 48–72h): Israel signaled it will intensify action unless Beirut enforces disarmament/pullbacks mandated in the 2024 framework; weekend/sun. strikes killed several Hezbollah operatives. UNIFIL separately condemned an armed incursion near Blida (Oct 30) and a prior drone-grenade incident against peacekeepers (Oct 26). [Reuters, Nov 2], [UNIFIL, Oct 30], [UNIFIL, Oct 26]
Assessment: Israel will likely sustain calibrated, high‑precision strikes and cross‑border raids to coerce state action while avoiding a wider war. Escalation risk elevated but contained. (Confidence: moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Levant / Israel–Lebanon

Signals & kinetics. Israeli leaders publicly press Lebanon to “fulfil commitments” on Hezbollah disarmament as strikes continue against Radwan-linked nodes; UN/EU statements underscore Blue Line violations and risk to UNIFIL. [Reuters, Nov 2], [UNIFIL, Oct 30], [EU EEAS, Oct 26]
Assessment: Coercive pressure will persist this week; a large‑casualty incident north of the Litani would rapidly raise escalation odds. (Confidence: moderate.)
Political optics. UN Security Council extended UNIFIL’s mandate in August, adding context to current friction on the ground. [Reuters, Aug 28]
Assessment: Any perceived UNIFIL constraint or drawdown talk emboldens tactical risk‑taking by belligerents. (Confidence: low–moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Black Sea / Ukraine

Front line. Russia claims it is tightening the ring around Pokrovsk and pressuring Kupiansk; ISW maps/assessments show Russian gains inside Pokrovsk urban area. Ukraine reports 160+ daily engagements and SOF actions. [Reuters, Nov 4], [ISW, Nov 3], [ISW map], [Ukrinform, Nov 4]
Assessment: Expect block‑by‑block combat, sustained drone/GLSDB/ballistic strikes on energy/logistics nodes; front remains fluid. (Confidence: moderate.)
Air defense & supply. Additional Patriot components reported delivered; Ukraine emphasizes bolstering air defense amid nightly drone volleys. [Defense News, Nov 3]
Assessment: Near‑term improvement to point defense around urban hubs, but magazine depth and repair cadence remain constraints. (Confidence: moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
South China Sea / Philippines

Coalition-building. Philippines–Canada SOVFA signed Nov 2, expanding Manila’s network after recent multinational patrols and creation of a US–PH joint task force. [Reuters, Nov 2], [AP, Nov 2], [Canadian DoND, Nov 2], [Reuters, Nov 1], [SCMP, Nov 4]
Assessment: Expect PRC CCG/PLA “presence ops” and sharper messaging; Manila’s expanded exercises/patrols likely to continue. (Confidence: high.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Near‑Term Business Actions (72h)

Hedge & liquidity: Re‑check fuel and freight hedges; scenario‑test +20–30% spot freight on SCS lanes, +10–15% EU gas on grid headlines.

Coverage & clauses: Verify war‑risk riders for Levant/East Med; confirm force‑majeure exclusions in supplier contracts.

Counterparty risk: Review exposures to Donetsk rail/energy nodes and Lebanese banking/FX channels.

Ops continuity: Identify alternates to SCS corridors (via Indonesia/Australia) for time‑sensitive shipments.

title: ChatGPT’s daily brief
text:
hello! this is the ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB) archive: an open-source intelligence digest compiled and rendered by ChatGPT 5 each morning for geopolitical news. I originally created this product for personal use so I could receive a summarized update of the day’s main issues without having to read multiple different newsletters. Adding it here in case folks find it useful.
Click any date below to view that day’s brief.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
What’s new: Israeli leaders signaled stepped-up operations unless Beirut delivers visible disarmament and withdrawals under the 2024 ceasefire; weekend strikes killed several Hezbollah operatives as rhetoric hardened.
Assessment: Israel will likely sustain calibrated, high-precision strikes and information ops this week to compel compliance while seeking to avoid a broad war. Escalation risk elevated but contained. (Confidence: moderate.)
Hostage/remains track: Media reports conflict over three sets of remains transferred from Gaza; some outlets reported they were hostages’ remains while others cited Israeli officials saying they were not.
Assessment: Ambiguity sustains mistrust and complicates truce maintenance; the hostage/remains channel will likely continue with episodic crises of confidence. (Confidence: low–moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
What’s new: Israeli leaders signaled stepped-up operations unless Beirut delivers visible disarmament and withdrawals under the 2024 ceasefire; weekend strikes killed several Hezbollah operatives as rhetoric hardened.
Assessment: Israel will likely sustain calibrated, high-precision strikes and information ops this week to compel compliance while seeking to avoid a broad war. Escalation risk elevated but contained. (Confidence: moderate.)
Hostage/remains track: Media reports conflict over three sets of remains transferred from Gaza; some outlets reported they were hostages’ remains while others cited Israeli officials saying they were not.
Assessment: Ambiguity sustains mistrust and complicates truce maintenance; the hostage/remains channel will likely continue with episodic crises of confidence. (Confidence: low–moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Levant / Israel–Lebanon

Signals & kinetics: Public demands that Lebanon “uphold commitments” to disarm Hezbollah, paired with ongoing cross‑border strikes targeting Radwan elements. Likely intent: coerce state action before winter and shape negotiations. (Confidence: moderate.)
Human terrain & optics: Continued incidents despite truce fuel domestic pressure in both countries; international calls for de‑escalation persist. (Confidence: low–moderate.)
Shift indicators: A large‑casualty strike north of the Litani, or visible LAF/UNIFIL seizures of major caches, would respectively raise or lower escalation odds quickly. (Confidence: moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Black Sea / Ukraine

Pokrovsk fight: Russia claims advances into Prigorodny with overnight strikes on military‑industrial targets; Ukraine says forces are holding and rotating SOF. Expect block‑by‑block combat and deep‑strike volleys against energy/logistics nodes. (Confidence: moderate.)
Market angle: Confirmed disruption to gas infrastructure or rail nodes near Donetsk Oblast would add headline risk to European energy and freight names. (Confidence: moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
South China Sea / Philippines

Canada–Philippines SOVFA: New visiting‑forces pact expands Manila’s coalition signaling after recent water‑cannon/shouldering incidents; expect PRC maritime “presence ops” to probe resolve. (Confidence: high.)
PLA posture: China has touted monitoring of Philippine patrols—likely to continue alongside messaging against “external interference.” (Confidence: moderate.)

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
What’s new (past 24–48h): Following last week’s evacuation alerts in Tayr Dibbah, Taibe, and Ayta al Jabal, Israel sustained targeted airstrikes on Hezbollah-linked infrastructure. UNIFIL confirmed observations of multiple strikes within its AO, while U.S. officials stepped up financial pressure on Iran–Hezbollah networks.
Assessment: Israel is likely to maintain calibrated, high-precision strike packages to constrain Hezbollah reconstitution below full-war thresholds. Hezbollah messaging frames adherence to a ceasefire while rejecting political talks—signaling bounded retaliation risk. A broader war remains possible but not the baseline. (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: UNIFIL (Nov 6–7); Reuters/AP (Nov 6–9).

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Levant / Israel–Lebanon

Kinetics & signals. UNIFIL logged multiple IAF airstrikes in southern Lebanon (Tayr Dibbah, Taibe, Ayta al Jabal). Israel asserts targets were Hezbollah infrastructure post-evacuation warnings. (Confidence: high.)
Cites: UNIFIL statements (Nov 6–7, 2025).

Hezbollah posture. Public statements reiterate Lebanon’s binding to a ceasefire but reject negotiations with Israel, preserving deterrent narratives while avoiding political engagement. (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: Reuters (Nov 6–7, 2025).

Financial pressure. A senior U.S. sanctions official signaled the time is right to cut Hezbollah funding channels tied to Iran. (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: Reuters (Nov 9, 2025).

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Black Sea / Ukraine

Pokrovsk urban fight. Russia claims house-to-house gains in Pokrovsk; Kyiv denies encirclement and reports ~196 clashes/day, with Pokrovsk the hottest sector. Expect continued deep-strike exchanges against rail/energy nodes. (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: Reuters (Nov 6, 2025); Ukrinform (Nov 9, 2025); ISW recent assessments.

Air defense & sustainment. Delivery of additional Patriot components bolsters point defense for critical nodes, but interceptor stock depth remains a constraint through winter. (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: Defense News (Nov 3, 2025); AP wire.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
South China Sea / Philippines

Coalition-building. The Philippines–Canada SOVFA (Nov 2) broadens Manila’s visiting-forces network; expect PRC presence ops and sharper messaging. (Confidence: high.)
Cites: Government of Canada (Nov 2, 2025); Reuters background.

At-sea friction. PLA Southern Theater continued public monitoring/criticism of allied and Philippine patrols (Oct 30–31). (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: Reuters (Nov 1, 2025); Philippine/SCMP regional reporting.

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Latin America / Venezuela

Caribbean strikes & sanctions overhang. The U.S. reported another lethal strike on a suspected drug vessel in international waters (Nov 6), amid ongoing debate over rules of engagement and legality. Venezuelan oil exports dipped in October on lower inventories and diluent imports. (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: Reuters (Nov 6 & Nov 3, 2025).

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Africa / Sahel–Horn–Sudan

Sudan crisis. UN leadership warned the war is spiraling out of control following RSF advances around El Fasher; ceasefire overtures circulate but hold weak. Displacement flows continue to spike. (Confidence: moderate.)
Cites: AP (Nov 5, 2025); Reuters (Nov 6, 2025); ReliefWeb/DTM (Nov 2–6, 2025).

title: ChatGPT Daily Brief (CDB)
text:
Near-Term Business Actions (72h)

Hedge & liquidity: Re-check fuel and freight hedges; scenario-test +20–30% spot freight on SCS lanes, +10–15% EU gas on grid headlines, and Caribbean tanker day-rate spikes.

Coverage & clauses: Validate war-risk riders for East-Med, Red Sea, and Caribbean lanes; confirm force-majeure and sanctions-compliance clauses in supplier contracts.

Counterparty risk: Review exposures to Donetsk rail/energy nodes, Lebanese banking/FX, PDVSA-linked counterparties, and Sahel gold logistics.

Ops continuity: Identify alternate routings (e.g., via Indonesia/Australia for SCS; via Atlantic lanes for Red Sea risk) and buffer inventory at vulnerable nodes.

title: analytics portfolio
text:
LinkedIn GitHub Analytics blog (Medium) 


hello! im riki!


this is a long-time coming but ive finally made a github pages… and it may be a long-time yet before this is fully fleshed out. In the meantime, here’s what you should know about me:


00. Full-stack analytics with economic policy background. I’ve spent 5+ years as a full-stack research and data person across economics and international policy institutions. My responsibilities have included pure research, data engineering, modelling, and application development, in a variety of settings which has allowed me to see the integration of data in economic policy firsthand.


01. I prototype, ship, and solve problems. I’ve engineered ETL pipelines from scratch to automate intake workflows and have built (too many) interactive dashboards analyzing data, including one on U.S. tariff and trade data. I currently lead an ML project that predicts farmer adoption rates of agricultural training using XGBoost, SHAP explainability, and R Shiny deployed for technical assistance teams.


02. I like learning new things.  I try to continuously upskill in ML/AI tooling, and I’m learning more about scalable solutions. Most recently, I used LangChain + ChromaDB to build an LLM-based app that generates private-sector diagnostics for investment teams. Outside work, I do judo, volunteer in the DC Community Emergency Response Team (CERT), and am pursuing my amateur HAM radio technician license.


03. I’m collaborative. At the end of the day, data analytics can’t be done in a silo. I like working in interdisciplinary teams, translating technical analysis into insights product managers and economists can act on. Whether it’s pairing with engineers to productionize a prototype application or brainstorming with project managers on dashboards, I always treat analytics as a team sport.



What I’m thinking about right now:


Point metrics don’t tell you whether the model outputs align with the observed data distribution.
I.e., if the model has a good (low) RMSE but predicts a noticeably different distribution, it might be overfitting the center and neglecting the tails. Distributional metrics help identify this.[image or embed]

— riki (@rikimatsumoto.bsky.social) September 5, 2025 at 1:47 PM

title: projects
text:
hello! here are some of the projects I’ve worked on.


0.1 U.S. Federal Expenditure tracker (Brookings)

For some interesting work I did with some colleagues (s/o Noadia + Lauren), check out this R Shiny app on U.S. Federal Outlays (spending)





0.2 Social spending mini-simulation

I created this simple mini-simulation to visualize how redistribution through social spending works. It’s quite “naive” in the sense that it models the income distribution of an entire country as ten shares. However, it helped me understand how redistribution directly impacts inequality metrics like the Gini coefficient.





0.3 U.S. Tariff & Trade tracker (Brookings)

During the height of the tariff uncertainty in Q1/Q2 2025, I developed a tariff tracker with my wonderful colleagues. Check it out!
